name: Hochschule für Technik und Wirtschaft Berlin
headAddress: Hochschule für Technik und Wirtschaft Berlin
goal: HTW Berlin - University of Applied Sciences with around 14,000 students, 370 scientific staff and 5 faculties is Berlin's largest university of applied sciences. It uses the diversity of its more than 70 degree programmes in the field of technology, information technology, economics, law, culture and design for networked cooperation. For HTW Berlin, research is a core task and a key factor for success. The researchers at HTW Berlin contribute their expertise and contacts to more than 150 thematically wide-ranging third-party funding projects every year, which are usually carried out in cooperation with partners from industry. HTW Berlin is also a full member of the European University Association (EUA).
interests: Budget, Communication, Competition, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Research and Innovation Funding Policies (Horizon2020, HorizonEurope), Higher Education Policy (ERASMUS+), European Partnerships, Regional Development Policies (ESIF)
